org.jasig.cas.adaptors.x509.authentication.handler.support.ldap

Class LdaptiveResourceCRLFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.adaptors.x509.authentication.handler.support.ResourceCRLFetcher
      • org.jasig.cas.adaptors.x509.authentication.handler.support.ldap.LdaptiveResourceCRLFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CRLFetcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PoolingLdaptiveResourceCRLFetcher

    @RefreshScope
 @Component(value="ldaptiveResourceCRLFetcher")
public class LdaptiveResourceCRLFetcher
extends ResourceCRLFetcher
    Fetches a CRL from an LDAP instance.
    Since:
    4.1

      • fetchCRLFromLdap

        protected java.security.cert.X509CRL fetchCRLFromLdap(java.lang.Object r)
                                               throws java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                                                      java.io.IOException,
                                                      java.security.cert.CRLException
        Downloads a CRL from given LDAP url.
        Parameters:
        r - the resource that is the ldap url.
        Returns:
        the x 509 cRL
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CRLException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - if connection to ldap fails, or attribute to get the revocation list is unavailable

      • fetchX509CRLFromAttribute

        protected java.security.cert.X509CRL fetchX509CRLFromAttribute(org.ldaptive.LdapAttribute aval)
                                                        throws java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                                                               java.io.IOException,
                                                               java.security.cert.CRLException
        Gets x509 cRL from attribute. Retrieves the binary attribute value, decodes it to base64, and fetches it as a byte-array resource.
        Parameters:
        aval - the attribute, which may be null if it's not found
        Returns:
        the x 509 cRL from attribute
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CRLException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - if connection to ldap fails, or attribute to get the revocation list is unavailable

      • performLdapSearch

        protected org.ldaptive.Response<org.ldaptive.SearchResult> performLdapSearch(java.lang.String ldapURL)
                                                                      throws org.ldaptive.LdapException
        Executes an LDAP search against the supplied URL.
        Parameters:
        ldapURL - to search
        Returns:
        search result
        Throws:
        org.ldaptive.LdapException - if an error occurs performing the search
